segment.source: Introduction to the WPA User Interface
segment.target: Introduction to the WPA User Interface

segment.source: Introduction to the WPA User Interface
segment.target: Introduction to the WPA User Interface

segment.source: Introduction to the WPA User Interface
segment.target: Introduction to the WPA User Interface

segment.source: The Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) user interface (UI) consists of a collection of docked windows that surround a central workspace.
segment.target: The Windows Performance Analyzer (WPA) user interface (UI) consists of a collection of docked windows that surround a central workspace.

segment.source: This central workspace contains Analysis tabs.
segment.target: This central workspace contains Analysis tabs.

segment.source: All windows can be undocked or moved and docked in a different location.
segment.target: All windows can be undocked or moved and docked in a different location.

segment.source: To open a closed window, select the window on the Window menu.
segment.target: To open a closed window, select the window on the Window menu.

segment.source: The following illustration shows the WPA UI.
segment.target: The following illustration shows the WPA UI.

segment.source: The Diagnostic Console window is not shown.
segment.target: The Diagnostic Console window is not shown.

segment.source: mockup of wpa layout with labels on various panes
segment.target: mockup of wpa layout with labels on various panes

segment.source: Graph Explorer Window
segment.target: Graph Explorer Window

segment.source: When you open a recording in WPA, thumbnails of all the graphs that apply to that recording appear in the Graph Explorer window, grouped under several nodes.
segment.target: When you open a recording in WPA, thumbnails of all the graphs that apply to that recording appear in the Graph Explorer window, grouped under several nodes.

segment.source: To expand a node, click the small triangle next to the node name.
segment.target: To expand a node, click the small triangle next to the node name.

segment.source: To see the full graph, drag the graph to the Analysis tab.
segment.target: To see the full graph, drag the graph to the Analysis tab.

segment.source: You can drag multiple graphs to the Analysis tab.
segment.target: You can drag multiple graphs to the Analysis tab.

segment.source: For more information, see Graph Explorer.
segment.target: For more information, see Graph Explorer.

segment.source: Analysis Tab
segment.target: Analysis Tab

segment.source: When you drag a graph from the Graph Explorer window to the Analysis tab, the graph appears together with a Legend control on the left.
segment.target: When you drag a graph from the Graph Explorer window to the Analysis tab, the graph appears together with a Legend control on the left.

segment.source: The Legend control explains the meaning of the lines or bars in the graph.
segment.target: The Legend control explains the meaning of the lines or bars in the graph.

segment.source: If you want to see the same data in tabular form, click the right-most layout icon on the graph title bar.
segment.target: If you want to see the same data in tabular form, click the right-most layout icon on the graph title bar.

segment.source: This opens the associated data table and reduces the graph to a thumbnail.
segment.target: This opens the associated data table and reduces the graph to a thumbnail.

segment.source: If you want to see both the full-size graph and the data table, click the left-most layout icon.
segment.target: If you want to see both the full-size graph and the data table, click the left-most layout icon.

segment.source: You can use the right drop-down arrow on the graph title bar to change from a line graph to a stacked-line graph or a stacked-bar graph.
segment.target: You can use the right drop-down arrow on the graph title bar to change from a line graph to a stacked-line graph or a stacked-bar graph.

segment.source: You can use the left drop-down arrow on the graph title bar to select different parameters for the graph, if more parameters are available.
segment.target: You can use the left drop-down arrow on the graph title bar to select different parameters for the graph, if more parameters are available.

segment.source: For example, you can view CPU usage by process, by CPU, or by process and thread.
segment.target: For example, you can view CPU usage by process, by CPU, or by process and thread.

segment.source: All graphs on the Analysis tab share a single timeline.
segment.target: All graphs on the Analysis tab share a single timeline.

segment.source: To view graphs that have a different timeline, open another Analysis tab by selecting New Analysis View on the Window menu.
segment.target: To view graphs that have a different timeline, open another Analysis tab by selecting New Analysis View on the Window menu.

segment.source: For more information, see Analysis Tab.
segment.target: For more information, see Analysis Tab.

segment.source: Analysis Assistant Window
segment.target: Analysis Assistant Window

segment.source: When you select a specific graph or data table, information about that specific graph and table displays in the Analysis Assistant.
segment.target: When you select a specific graph or data table, information about that specific graph and table displays in the Analysis Assistant.

segment.source: Use this as a guide during your analysis.
segment.target: Use this as a guide during your analysis.

segment.source: For more information, see Analysis Assistant.
segment.target: For more information, see Analysis Assistant.

segment.source: Issues Window
segment.target: Issues Window

segment.source: If you created the recording in the Assessment Platform, the Issues window lists issues that the assessment identifies.
segment.target: If you created the recording in the Assessment Platform, the Issues window lists issues that the assessment identifies.

segment.source: This window is docked on the upper-right corner.
segment.target: This window is docked on the upper-right corner.

segment.source: If you did not create the recording in the Assessment Platform, this window is minimized because there is no data.
segment.target: If you did not create the recording in the Assessment Platform, this window is minimized because there is no data.

segment.source: When you click an issue in this window, details for that issue appear in the Details window.
segment.target: When you click an issue in this window, details for that issue appear in the Details window.

segment.source: All identified issues appear on the Analysis tab below any graphs that you have opened.
segment.target: All identified issues appear on the Analysis tab below any graphs that you have opened.

segment.source: For more information, see Issues Window.
segment.target: For more information, see Issues Window.

segment.source: Details Window
segment.target: Details Window

segment.source: If you created the recording in the Assessment Platform, the Details window appears below the Issues window in the lower-right corner of the workspace.
segment.target: If you created the recording in the Assessment Platform, the Details window appears below the Issues window in the lower-right corner of the workspace.

segment.source: The Details window provides details about the selected issue and recommended solutions.
segment.target: The Details window provides details about the selected issue and recommended solutions.

segment.source: For more information, see Details Window.
segment.target: For more information, see Details Window.

segment.source: Diagnostic Console Window
segment.target: Diagnostic Console Window

segment.source: The Diagnostic Console window is docked at the bottom of the workspace.
segment.target: The Diagnostic Console window is docked at the bottom of the workspace.

segment.source: This window provides a list of exceptions in the recording and details related to symbol loading and decoding.
segment.target: This window provides a list of exceptions in the recording and details related to symbol loading and decoding.

segment.source: For more information, see Diagnostic Console Window.
segment.target: For more information, see Diagnostic Console Window.

segment.source: Classic Menu and Rich Menu
segment.target: Classic Menu and Rich Menu

segment.source: By default, WPA uses the Classic menu when you open a recording.
segment.target: By default, WPA uses the Classic menu when you open a recording.

segment.source: Like most applications, the Classic Menu displays menus (File, Trace, etc.) at the top.
segment.target: Like most applications, the Classic Menu displays menus (File, Trace, etc.) at the top.

segment.source: If you prefer a more compact, intuitive, and modern UI, you can use the Rich Menu.
segment.target: If you prefer a more compact, intuitive, and modern UI, you can use the Rich Menu.

segment.source: The Rich Menu:
segment.target: The Rich Menu:

segment.source: Pulls together the old menus from the Classic Menu
segment.target: Pulls together the old menus from the Classic Menu

segment.source: Features shortcuts to menus you frequently use, such as Open, Apply Profile, Load Symbols, etc.
segment.target: Features shortcuts to menus you frequently use, such as Open, Apply Profile, Load Symbols, etc.

segment.source: Uses only one menu (File) as the entry point to all of the menu options
segment.target: Uses only one menu (File) as the entry point to all of the menu options

segment.source: For more information on the differences between the Classic Menu and Rich Text menu and how to switch back-and-forth between them, see Classic versus Rich Menu.
segment.target: For more information on the differences between the Classic Menu and Rich Text menu and how to switch back-and-forth between them, see Classic versus Rich Menu.

segment.target: Related topics
